Tom Roche Feb 14, 2007 3:29 pm ((PST))
>> Slightly offtopic, but since it's something that OP probably run
>> into, and I didn't see it answered in the FAQ, I thought I'd ask:
>> how to include JUnit JARs with JARed test code? What I mean:

<snip/>

>> I wrote a JUnit test that calls the code that calls the app, and
>> rebuilt the JAR (from eclipse). Eclipse compiled the new
>> JUnit-using class OK, and included that class in the JAR it built,
>> but the JAR does not contain junit.jar or any of its classes. So to
>> deploy the new JAR, I just unzipped junit.jar on top of my JAR's
>> contents, changed the Main-Class in its manifest, and re-JARed,
>> deployed, and ran.

Joakim Ohlrogge Thu Feb 15, 2007 12:14 am ((PST))
> I think you need to deploy both your jar and the JUnit jar on the
> target system.

For now that's not an option, so I just automated the above with a
target like

  <target name="add.jars" depends="compile" 
    description="add JARs to be shipped with our JAR">
    <unjar
      dest="${compile.outdir}"
      overwrite="false">
      <fileset dir="${source.lib.dir}">
        <include name="**/*.jar"/>
      </fileset>
    </unjar>
  </target>
